author: IGN
description:
In today's Daily Fix:
Grand Theft Auto is officially delayed to May of 2026. Fans are likely pretty disappointed in the news, but it's not entirely unexpected as they haven't shown anything of the game since its first trailer in 2023. But you know who's probably more disappointed? Take-Two Interactive stockholders. The company, who owns GTA developer Rockstar Games, took a hit in its share price after the announcement, but they're looking to bounce back with other game releases this year, including Borderlands 4. In other news, Hollow Knight: Silksong fans are a little confused at some official art from the game that appears to feature protagonist Hornet...undressing? And finally, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is such a hit that even French President Emmanuel Macron has heard about it.
title: GTA 6 Delay Makes Take-Two Stock Prices Plummet - IGN Daily Fix

author: IGN
description:
This video for The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered offers players a comprehensive walkthrough on how to join three of the major guilds in the game: the Fighters Guild, the Mages Guild, and the Arena. Aimed at newcomers or returning players, we outline the benefits of guild memberships, such as better gear, exclusive services, and easy access to resting spots. We’ll explain where to go, whom to talk to, and what kind of initial quests to expect. 

How to Join the Dark Brotherhood: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZzlaF1bkg9M
How to Join the Thieves Guild: https://youtu.be/ZZT3pT-oxt4?si=lgbSTznzplakHp67

00:00 Intro  
00:29 Fighters Guild  
01:27 The Arena  
02:14 Mages Guild 

#IGN #Gaming #Oblivion
title: Oblivion Remastered: How to Join the Fighters Guild, Mages Guild, and the Arena

author: IGN
description:
Get a peek at gameplay and more in this latest Wuchang: Fallen Feathers trailer for the upcoming Soulslike action RPG. Wuchang: Fallen Feathers will be available on Xbox Series X|S, Windows, day one on Game Pass, PS5 (PlayStation 5), and PC via Epic Games Store and Steam on July 24, 2025.

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers is set in the dark and tumultuous late Ming Dynasty, plagued with warring factions and a mysterious illness spawning monstrous creatures. Become Wuchang, a skilled pirate warrior struck by amnesia, who must navigate the uncertainties of her mysterious past while afflicted by the horrific feathering disease.

#IGN #Gaming
title: Wuchang: Fallen Feathers - Official Trailer

description: Explore the unsettling world of A.A.U. in this announcement trailer for the upcoming narrative-driven horror experience set in the desolate remnants of Uzovnica—a shut-down Yugoslav town steeped in mystery, guilt, and terror. Whether you're struggling with tricky locks or just want to unlock every chest and door in the game, this video will teach you everything you need to know, from understanding the mechanics to using the Skeleton Key for infinite lockpicks.

author: IGN
description:
Grand Theft Auto 6 has been delayed to May 26th, 2026. But that doesn’t mean 2025 won’t have an awesome selection of games to play instead! Here are the best games of 2025 to tide you over until GTA 6 in 2026 when we can finally return to Vice City. What do you think about the GTA 6 delay?

From Doom: The Dark Ages to Mario Kart World and more, 2025 is packed with awesome video games. So whether you're a Borderlands 4 fan, or Ghost of Yotei is more up your street, the best game of 2025 are looking like they'll easily fill that GTA 6 shaped hole in your life. At least until GTA 6 releases in 2026.

Are you distraught, or do you see is as a chance to work through your gaming backlog and maybe try more of the best video games of 2025? let us know in the comments.

#Gaming #IGN #GTA6
title: GTA 6 is Delayed to 2026 - Here Are 32 Awesome Games Coming in 2025 You Can Play Instead

author: IGN
description:
Darkness looms over Limveld, threatening the very essence of our world. Gather your strength, Nightfarers. The Nightlord must fall. Get a deep dive into Elden Ring Nightreign in this overview trailer for the upcoming standalone cooperative spin-off set in a world parallel to that of 2022’s Elden Ring. The new Elden Ring Nightreign trailer digs into the story, your objectives, the world, formidable enemies you'll face, the Nightlords bosses, a breakdown of the Nightfarers and their abilities, and more. Elden Ring Nightreign launches on PS5 (PlayStation 5), PS4 (PlayStation 4), Xbox Series X/S, and PC via Steam on May 30, 2025.

#IGN #Eldenringnightreign #Gaming
title: Elden Ring Nightreign - Official Overview Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Fans of the Alien and Predator franchises have a lot to look forward to in 2025. Not only are we getting two new Predator films from Prey director Dan Trachtenberg with the live-action Predator: Badlands and the animated Hulu offering Predator: Killer of Killers, but we’re also set to receive another major entry in the Alien universe from Fargo and Legion showrunner Noah Hawley with the FX show Alien: Earth. Although these projects are not officially connected yet, fans know that Alien and Predator have a long history as part of a shared universe, with the two iconic monsters crossing paths in numerous films, comic books, and video games.
Examining the latest promotional materials for Predator: Badlands and Alien: Earth may provide clues that Disney is laying the groundwork for a new crossover between Alien and Predator. Let’s take a closer look at the developments in these franchises and why we might see AVP return to the big screen sooner rather than later.
title: Do These Easter Eggs Mean a New Alien vs. Predator Movie Is Coming?

author: IGN
description: IGN sits down with the actors who portrayed Yasuke and Naoe in Assassin's Creed Shadows, Tongayi Chirisa and MASUMI. IGN host Akeem Lawanson talks through their journey, joining the Assassin's Creed Brotherhood, their first AC game, and how they landed their respective roles as Yasuke and Naoe in Assassin's Creed Shadows. Yasuke is the first historical figure Ubisoft made a playable character, as opposed to creating their very own. We ask Tongayi how it feels to hold such a title in the series as it pertains to #AssassinsCreedShadows. MASUMI also has an interesting path as to how she attained the role of Naoe in #AssassinsCreed Shadows, which is explored at length.
title: Assassin's Creed Shadow Cast Rank Iconic Samurai Scenes and Describe Yasuke and Naoe's Relationship

author: IGN
description:
In this snippet from podcast Beyond 894, Max and Jada give Nick their honest reactions about the Until Dawn movie thats very much not like the game outside of two things you probably never would have guessed. Is this worth watching if you're a fan of cheesy slashers? Or is Until Dawn just a big ol' yawn? 

This week’s show is Max Scoville, Jada Griffin, Nick Maillet, and is produced by Red Rigos

Check out the full episode here - https://youtu.be/jJzutLzaFfg?si=P03xmKgsCYLk8vA6

#UntilDawn #Beyond #IGN
title: Until Dawn: 2 Things From The Game The Movie Got Right - Beyond Clips

author: IGN
description: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered is here, and it’s a hit, showing players are more than happy to make return trips to some of Bethesda’s older open worlds, in case that wasn’t readily apparent based on how many people bought Skyrim more than once. But this is good news! Bethesda Game Studios’ last original open-world RPG outing was Starfield, which was certainly ambitious, but didn’t quite have players over the moon with joy. Before that was Fallout 76, which has since sorted itself out, but only after a very rough launch. The Elder Scrolls VI is still years away, and Fallout 5 even further out than that, so perhaps more remakes like Oblivion are the answer to stoke the fires of Bethesda fandom, and help build anticipation for the next installments in these storied series. A Fallout 3 Remake (or remaster) has been all-but-confirmed, and if that’s possible, an overhauled New Vegas would be welcomed with open arms. Meanwhile, giving The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind a remaster o
title: Oblivion Shows Remakes Could Be Key to Bethesda Getting Back on Track

author: IGN
description:
Welcome back to Next-Gen Console Watch! The Nintendo Switch 2 officially went up for preorder in the United States last week, and it went about as well as one might expect considering it's the follow-up to one of the best-selling gaming consoles of all time. Websites crasheds, credit card charges were declined, launch day deliveries were missed—it was chaos. Although many prevailed in securing a Switch 2 preorder, it wasn't easy; why hasn't the games industry learned from this? Why aren't retailers like Best Buy and Walmart better prepared for big consumer-focused moments? Should console manufacturers just bypass third-party retailers and sell directly to consumers? Plus we have last week's poll and a new poll for you to vote on at IGN.com.

And don't forget to secure your tickets to IGN Live! Our big in-person event is returning to Los Angeles June 7-8, after a major turnout last year. Visit IGN.com/Live for details and tickets.

#IGN #Gaming
title: Console Pre-orders Are Still a Disaster - Next-Gen Console Watch

author: IGN
description:
Check out the Everything's Going to Be Great trailer for the upcoming comedy drama starring Allison Janney, Bryan Cranston, Benjamin Evan Ainsworth, Jack Champion, Simon Rex, and Chris Cooper.

There’s no business like show business — for Buddy and Macy Smart (Primetime Emmy winner Bryan Cranston and Oscar winner Allison Janney) that means an unpredictable life in regional theater while trying to raise their radically different sons, Lester and Derrick. Through it all, Buddy pursues his unstoppable dreams, and Macy is left to pull it all together and keep the family afloat. As the family grapples with identity and belonging, they share a humorous and heartfelt journey of self-discovery, learning the power of owning your spotlight, no matter what stage of life you’re in.

Everything's Going to Be Great is produced by Alex Lalonde, p.g.a., Bryan Unkeless, p.g.a., and Steven Rogers, p.g.a. It is written by Steven Rogers.

Everything's Going to Be Great, directed by Jon S. Baird, premiere
title: Everything's Going to Be Great - Official Trailer (2025) Bryan Cranston, Allison Janney
